skill.name: feature-design-assistant
skill.description: Turn ideas into fully formed designs and specs through natural collaborative dialogue. Use when planning new features, designing architecture, or making significant changes to the codebase.
skill.summary: Turn ideas into fully formed designs and specs through natural collaborative dialogue. Use when plan...
skill.author: notedit

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code, no file operations, no network access, and no external commands. Contains only structured dialogue templates for collaborative feature design.

content.value_statement: Transform vague ideas into clear, actionable feature designs through structured conversation. Guide users through requirements gathering, approach selection, and architecture planning.
actual_capabilities: Gather feature requirements through structured AskUserQuestion dialogues
Explore codebase context to understand project patterns and structure
Present multiple design approaches with pros and cons for user selection
Generate detailed design documents with implementation task checklists
limitations: Does not execute code or make file changes directly
Requires user participation in multi-step dialogue process
Does not integrate with external project management tools
Output is documentation only, not auto-generated code

use_cases.title: Spec New Features
use_cases.description: Transform product ideas into clear technical specifications for development teams

use_cases.title: Plan System Changes
use_cases.description: Design architecture approaches for new features with stakeholder validation

use_cases.title: Break Down Work
use_cases.description: Create implementation task lists from feature requirements for sprint planning

prompt_templates.title: Start Feature Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design a new feature for [describe your idea]. Use the feature-design-assistant skill to guide me through understanding requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Refine Existing Design
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a feature design that needs review. Help me validate it and identify gaps using structured questions.

prompt_templates.title: Plan API Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a new API endpoint for [functionality]. Guide me through data models, error handling, and documentation needs.

prompt_templates.title: Create Implementation Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Turn this feature design into an implementation checklist with prioritized tasks for our sprint.

output_examples.input: Help me design a user notification system for our SaaS app
output: Goal: New Functionality | Users: End Users, Admins | Scope: Medium (3-5 days)
Layers: Data Model, Business Logic, API, UI
Architecture: Notification service with event subscribers, channel adapters
Next: Create design document and implementation tasks

best_practices: Use multi-select questions when options are not mutually exclusive to gather comprehensive requirements efficiently
Validate understanding after each design section rather than waiting until the end to catch misunderstandings early
Follow YAGNI principle by removing unnecessary features from designs to keep implementations focused
anti_patterns: Asking single questions one at a time instead of batching up to 4 questions per AskUserQuestion call
Skipping the context discovery phase and designing without understanding existing codebase patterns
Presenting only one approach without alternatives, limiting stakeholder choice and buy-in

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires AskUserQuestion tool support.

faq.question: How long does a complete design session take?
faq.answer: Small features take 10-15 minutes. Complex features may require 30-60 minutes of dialogue.

faq.question: Can I save designs for later use?
faq.answer: Design documents are saved to docs/designs/ directory for future reference and implementation.

faq.question: Is my project data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads your codebase context. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: What if I need to revise a design later?
faq.answer: Design documents are markdown files. Edit them directly or re-run the skill for iterative improvements.

faq.question: How does this compare to /feature-analyzer?
faq.answer: This skill uses structured dialogue for collaborative design. /feature-analyzer may use different approaches.
